messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Digest Number 866
messages.msgSnippet: ... When we were looking for rental houses 3 years ago in Florida we were told it was a specific number of square feet per person.  No one ever said anything
messages.messageBody:
On 4/15/06, Jessica <patchworkgirl@...> wrote:
>
> FWIW, back in the mid 90s, when our twins were little, we were not allowed
> to rent a 1 bedroom apartment for the 4 of us; we had to get a 2 bedroom
> unit... we probably could have rented a 1 bedroom HOUSE with no
> problem...then once our 3rd child came along, we would have had to get a 3
> bedroom apartment (the law in Texas apparently says something along the
> lines of 1 bedroom for every 2 people in apartments) but had no problem
> renting a 2 bedroom house...


When we were looking for rental houses 3 years ago in Florida we were told
it was a specific number of square feet per person. No one ever said
anything to me about bedrooms. We just fit into the house we were renting.
Then when my co-parent moved in with us we were over the limit. We just
didn't say anything to the property managers. But we were also looking to
buy a house at that time, so it wasn't much of an issue anyway.





--
Michelle
Independent Kitchen Consultant #413652

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Digest Number 866
messages.msgSnippet: FWIW, back in the mid 90s, when our twins were little, we were not allowed to rent a 1 bedroom apartment for the 4 of us; we had to get a 2 bedroom unit... we
messages.messageBody:
FWIW, back in the mid 90s, when our twins were little, we were not allowed to rent a 1 bedroom apartment for the 4 of us; we had to get a 2 bedroom unit... we probably could have rented a 1 bedroom HOUSE with no problem...then once our 3rd child came along, we would have had to get a 3 bedroom apartment (the law in Texas apparently says something along the lines of 1 bedroom for every 2 people in apartments) but had no problem renting a 2 bedroom house...

I don't think it has anything to do with gender but with the number of people or somesuch nonsense...

FYI I found information about # of occupants here: http://www.reiclub.com/articles/occupancy-standards-policy

TCHR "Maximum-Persons-Per-Bedroom" Occupancy Policy For Families

Cheers,

Jessica

http://weavingrainbow.com/HSblog

On 15 Apr 2006 00:29:40 -0000
unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com wrote:

> I've chalked it up to urban legend because I've been searching all day
> to no avail and have worded it upteen different ways in the search
> engine. The most I've gotten is someont *thinks* its a law in some
> states.
